text: Used for so many years with no issue. I have since changed brands, but for reasons that don't concern the brand Tidy Cats directly (I try to go for corn-based now). Their litter is great. It does have a basic litter smell, but does a good job at trapping cat odors. It's not especially dusty on my medium-hair black cat either (nothing is perfect with a black cat though lol), and seems to like it just fine too, never had issues with the texture or anything. The lightweight aspect always made it easy for me to carry a box home, if I couldn't get it delivered through amazon.I actually still do use it a bit. I use 50/50 of this, with the other part being corn-based litter. I find the corn litter struggles a bit more with cat odors, but has a gentler basic smell. Combining the two litters gives out a great balance for odor control!
